info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 7 at 7:37PM EDT until April 9 at 2:11AM EDT by NWS Columbia SC
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina...
Stevens Creek Near Modoc affecting McCormick and Edgefield Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Stevens Creek near Modoc.
* WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Farmland along Stevens Creek above the US Highway 23 bridge near Modoc becomes flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EDT Monday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 20.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don't drown.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don't drown.
Report any flooding directly to the Columbia National Weather Service at 803 234 4115 when it is safe to do so. You can also send reports by Facebook or Twitter to NWSColumbia or by e-mail at NWS.Columbia@noaa.gov.
Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1000 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
